--- In archive-crawler@yahoogr=
oups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> It means the necessary robots=
.txt prerequisite fetch (even getting a 
> 404) couldn't complete before gi=
ving up on the URI in question.
> 
> Do you see preceding matching /robots.=
txt requests in the crawl.log 
> showing failure codes?
> 
> Other causes c=
ould be changing your scope such that /robots.txt URIs 
> can't be schedule=
d, or setting the retries on URIs to a very small 
> number. (A URi coming =
up for consideration, then being rescheduled to 
> wait for DNS and then ro=
bots prerequisite fetches each counts as a 
> retry, so a retry count under=
 3 prevents this normal consider, 
> fetch-prereqs, retry operation.)
> 
> =
- Gordon @ IA
